intro: Halecus mauritianus, commonly known as the Mauritius halecus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and riverine habitats. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
